description:
Been going there one or twice a week  for a number of years. Prices are high (value meals are 10.00+) yet in line with McDonalds. The place is open 24 hours and does have a security guard to keep the street people from bothering the patrons. Service is quick, the staff is polite, the place is  clean. Time for eating is limited to 30-40 minutes after meal pick up.

The Carls jr at the Un plaza has been closed for a number of years. When it was open there were problems with street dwellers coming in to beg for "spare change" .
author: Jo A.

description:
I was in the city visiting the movie theater and I was unable to find a place to eat a hamburger inside the Westfield Plaza so I looked on my Yelp app and found a Carl's Jr. When I walked through the door I experienced sticker shock. $12 for a Value Meal for a Double Bacon Cheesburger?!?!?

Well I was a sucker and I paid it and after tax it was something around 14 to 15 dollars which really was not a bargain. I can understand maybe a movie theater charging prices if something like this was inside the theater but it was a regular area and can't help to think it takes advantage of tourists in the area looking for a quick affordable bite to eat.

The place also looks suspect and there were security guards there, saw many sketchy people hang out there. Just does not feel safe to be honest. But the guard that worked there and the person who took my order were nice at least. But I think I'll eat something at home before searching for options like Carl's Jr in this area again.
author: Jason C.

description:
$9 Six Dollar Burger!?!?!

This is by far has to be the very most expencive Carl's Jr in the chain.

Rent must be extraordinary but please just rename the $6 burger. 

I just wanted a quick burger to stave off hunger pangs and the cashier got all my special requests correct, she was great. The Lobby was clean and security kept things in order. Easy job because the place was empty!!! I know I wont return based on prices alone.

BK on Powell offers the national specials, and menu prices are in line. Chipotle, Subway, Panda, and In n Out all with high rent locals charge fair national pricing. 

Keep your tidy, empty lobby and your $9w tax/ 6 buck burger that's half the price or better at any other location.
author: Jim V.

description: This place is so expensive! It's over $10 for a breakfast burrito meal. When did Carl's Jr become more expensive than a coffee and food from Starbucks? I mean, the burritos are very tasty and warm with fresh eggs and large chunks of meat but seriously, the prices are ridiculous. I like that there's a security guard or two here but it does tell you it gets sketchy. The service is not very friendly and I suppose they have to deal with a lot of crap but still, please be nice to the paying customers.
author: Jen L.

description:
Avoid this place at all costs, this place is filthy and always has a bunch of homeless people in there sleeping and "hanging out" this place is a complete joke!

The employee's are all rude and have nasty attitudes. I was eating my food in the corner and then a employee decided to mop the floor around me as I'm eating smh who does that.

I had to wait 15mins to use the bathroom becuase some homeless guy was in there doing drugs, horrible place to eat at!
author: Jesse B.

description: Got my order wrong, inattentive, expensive, doesn't take American Express like they're some local mom and pop shop and not a multi-million dollar corporation. Just get McDonald's and save yourself the grief.
author: Mauricio B.

description: This is in the heart of downtown San Francisco, and it was very high priced and they only have a limited menu items. They are way overpriced on their items, they might as well serve everything a la carte. The place was fairly clean and you are unable to use the restrooms they were "Out of Service". I ordered a Bacon Egg and Cheese Biscuit meal, oh wait they have NO Bisquits there, they only use sourdough bread or buns, I mean really not come on, if your going to have breakfast menu items why not just offer lunch items only. They really need to rethink this menu and offer to customers. I even noticed that they will charge for a cup of ice. Insane. I have noticed that where I'm originally from they have Hardees and they are better than the Carls Jr out west. I probably will not go to this location again. On the upper side the food was served hot. Probably the only good thing they had going but like anything else they were not busy at all
author: Travis F.

description:
I haven't eaten at Carl's Jr. in quite sometime. 
Tonight's visit pretty much sums up why. 

It's not my favorite place to eat, mostly because of the clientele it attracts late at night.  But tonight I was hungry, & so I made the trek all the way to Carl's Jr.  Passing McDonalds, Jack in the Box, and even Burger King, because I had the craving for a burger at CJ's. 

When I get there, it's empty. Except one guy walking out asking if Burger King is still open, & another guy munching down on his food at a table inside. 

I walk up to the counter & say hi to the guy working. He's an older Asian guy, hunched over. 
I begin to order my food & he cuts me off:
Him: "No food!"
Me: "Excuse me?"
Him: No food!  The kitchen is closed."

I pull out my phone to check the time. Midnight seems like an odd time to close the kitchen for a restaurant that's open 24 HOURS!!!!!

Him: "The kitchen cook closed the kitchen to clean the kitchen for 3 hours."  (that's really what he said)

I'm not stupid enough to argue with the people who would potentially make my food. And so I left. Hungry & pissed off that I walked all the way over there for nothing. 
It's BS.  The kitchen doesn't close on a 24/7 restaurant, much less for 3 f-ing hours!!!!

Get your sh!t together Carl's Jr.!!  There's a reason your reviews are so low. I only hope my 1 star pulls you lower!!
author: Reed S.

description: I had the Big Carl burger. It was awful. It was sloppily put together, and it is just an extra dollop or two of Big Mac sauce on a mediocre bun and burger. It was $6. The place is very seedy too. The countless SF hobos are everywhere and this place seems to draw its share.
author: Soy L.

description: The security gave me a hard time because my card gets declined every time I go here , but I have hundred of dollars I my account and have to walk two extra blocks to pull out money , I'm not sure this place excepts Wells Fargo because this has happened to me many times . Also the security is probably not nice because of the over flow of homeless he has to deal with witch indefinitely makes him bitter
author: Big M.

description: 30 minute wait for "fast food". This place is ridiculous. Do not come here. Fries were soggy. Burger was over cooked. Just go to the bk across the street.
author: Nelson A.

description:
Disgusting，especially Teriyaki Burger, too salty
Location is good, but Taste needs improvement！！！！
author: Zhixian L.

description: $11 for a burger deal? Way overpriced.  I wouldn't bat an eye if this place closed down.  Too bad... staff is friendly but the food is average and you get a better deal at the Jack in the Box on Geary.  Now Carl Jr's no longer serves malts.  But they raised the price again.
author: Marc P.

description: I had the absolute worst experience at this location.  I mean sub standard service is to be expected of a fast food restaurant but, basic human respect should never be compromised. The security guard at this location HUMILIATED ME in front of the entire restaurant. After paying for and eating my meal, I asked to be "buzzed in" to the restroom which is for customers only. After eating burgers and fries it is normal to have to relieve yourself. While I was in the restroom I was bombarded with unnecessary banging on the door from who I recognized to be the voice of the security guard. She the proceeded to ask me what I was doing to which I responded "using the restroom." She told me I needed to be out so that others could use it. Mind you, this is the only co-ed stall in an open floor plan restaurant! I told her I would be out when I was finished. She then preceded to tell other guest just outside the restroom that I was "doing something I didn't have any business" insinuating that I was doing drugs or some type of illegal or inappropriate activity. After arguing with me through the door for several moments, to which I just continually repeated I will be out when I am finished. Once I exited the restroom I was met with a handful of stares from all the guests who had witnessed this embarrassing experience. I went to the counter to demand to speak with the manger. At first the manager on duty lied and said she wasn't the manger, then I said "I work in restaurants I know there is a manger in duty" which caused her to be truthful and take some ownership. After I asked her to speak with the guard I exited the building to find the guard on the phone with the police trying to get me arrested for using the bathroom too long! When she saw me exit she disconnected the call and went back in to further humiliate me by talking about the incident with other guests! I know because the door was slightly ajar and I could HEAR HER. I went back into the restaurant to ask the for the general managers name, the cashier didn't even bother to turn around and speak to me he spoke with his back to me. He told me the guards name was Tanisha and the managers name was Molly. As I asked for this information the guard mocked and taunted me saying thugs like "you want the 800 number" showing zero remorse or respect. She kept saying "I love my job." This is the customer service industry in San Francisco! I pay too much in rent to be treated like trash at a place where I come to eat! Tanisha should be fired and the staff should be re trained. Even as a manger in the customer service industry, not even m worst employees have ever treated any of my guests with such arrogance. The entire altercation could be heard by all the guests. I was made to look like I had done something wrong for no reason what so ever. I will be contacting corporate.
author: Que A.

description: Nice place for eating lunch, especially if you crave fast food! I think it could use stricter laws against panhandlers, but what can you do?
author: Julio B.

description: This is a good store, the only reason for lack of stars is because of the pan handling outside of the door. The staff does what it can to detour these people, but it is like trying to keep back the ocean with a teaspoon. If you can bulldog your way through, the food was hot, fresh and tasted good
author: Paul G.

description: I was really disappointed by this burger place. I didn't expect much (it's a burger fast food joint, after all) but also not so little. I got a fairly small but tasty burger, the fries were so bad and burnt that I didn't even finish them, and the soda was a bit watery. And it wasn't cheap. I'm not coming back.
author: Nadav H.

description: I was here today for a customer's order they did not have the order customer wanted so I texted them to see what they want instead. I was surfing on my phone while waiting, that huge black security guy comes to me in a very rude way and tells me to get out.  He does not even listens what i have to say. Just a miserable guy who hates himself and his job. Very rude and unreasonable! It smells like burned tires in there.
author: Nashua J.

description:
Urrrghhhhh Yelp made me give a star instead of leaving it empty .... 


I don't eat fast food often, but my cousin and I wanted a snack before our concert, she wanted some fries sooooo we came here. 
I know this place isn't a nice place because .... Duh it's downtown 
We ordered chicken tenders instead, waited 10 minutes while others after us got their orders
I also had to pee. Their bathroom door says vacant but it's auto lock, you have to tell the employees to press it open. 
I asked the girl? to open it, and she did. But I was just walking to it from the counter like .... shouldn't you press it when I get closer. 
I gave up so I didn't go. 
There was an another Asian girl (the manager I guess) she was upset with everyone behind the kitchen. Shouting at them to stop making so much meat and stop wrapping because it's too much 
First time here out of desperation, of course will never be back.
author: Fiona B.

description:
Came here to get my burger fix.

Parking is horrendous here as it's right next to Market Street.

The location is pretty beaten up. The staff were busy gossiping away in Cantonese while efficiently cranking out burgers.

The seating area here is somewhat large, and there were plenty of seats.

Lastly, the Big Carl I had hit the spot and felt good.  So greasy and beautiful.  Especially that sauce they use.
author: Edward L.

description: Ketchup from the pump by the soft drinks is watered down other than that great. Except the soda pop is also extremely sweet like there is too much syrup or something.
author: Ginger B.

description:
Came here after 2am on New Year's Eve.  Most restaurants are closed at that hour, so the venue earns a great deal of good will just due to being in service. 

They were busy, but we quickly managed to get a table.  

I ordered their six dollar burger and fries.  It came out to eleven dollars.  Pricer than I expected for fast food.  The burger was good, no aftertaste.  The fries were good too. 

I would return.  I liked it more than the Civic Center Carl's Jr.  Tamer clientele.

Edit:  Checked my receipt.  The Six Dollar Burger was $7.29 before tax, and the Small Fries were $2.70 pre tax.  $7.29 for a "Six Dollar Burger" is false advertising...
author: Joseph B.

description: Good God. There can't be a more sad place in the world... Then security there seems more concerned with a woman eating a salad from another business than the gang bangers yelling 'rule RICHMOND' and 'blowing caps' at the tourists coming in... food gave me instant sick stomach but there is no public restroom.
author: Thadd L.

description: I feel like you have to beat your way threw the apocalypse, but once you get there the place is alright.Carl's Jr is expensive everywhere and it's not because they offer their employees a living wage. It's all profit. BUT when everything else closes at 9 they're still open. The people at the counter are friendly enough and the food is what's to be expected! The restrooms are clean and the vagrants seem to stay outside.
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
What a trash ass fast food joint. 

I blame this because of it's location. It's right in Union Square and a lot of homeless people solicit right in front the entry/exit way to the BART. On top of that there's an actual security guard. It's really sketchy and that's just in the day time. 

However, my shitty experience was because my order got fucked up. I ordered a combo meal with a side of Bacon fries, paid for that, and only received one order of fries which I didn't discover until I was across the Bay. The only reason this didn't receive 1 star is because the bacon fries were delicious.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
It's bad enough that the Six Dollar Burger is over $6 for the original, but it's even worse when it isn't the right patty.
I rarely eat burgers but when I do I get the six dollar burger because it's the only one who's meat doesn't make me throw up. It didn't look like the right patty & 1 bite I knew it wasn't. 
I tried to show them their mistake & they refused, insisting it was angus beef. This is not angus beef! But since I'm starving & waited 10 minutes for this burger I'm going to eat it, but most likely I will be throwing it up in half an hour.
Those of you that do eat the 6 dollar burgers, tell me, DOES THIS LOOK LIKE ONE TO YOU?!?
Gross.
author: Samantha M.

description: This location does take pride and care in trying to keep up on all levels. It is no one's fault that this is a mecca for homeless peoples. They are open 24 hours, which is necessary in a land of scarce fast food joints, and they are firm and bold to do so. Items are a bit pricier than a normal Carl's Jr., but it's in Union Square. I visit often enough to tell you the place does not smell like urine, and the bathrooms are clean. Security just doesn't stand around. They regulate.
author: David D.

description:
I agree with all the one star reviewers on yelp about this place. The two reasons I give this place 2 stars is
1. It is open 24 hours
2. It accepts ebt

If any other burger place (In n Out, Jack in the Box) had both these criteria met, I would never step in this overpriced cespool ever again.

Also, granted it isnt worthy of a full star the food I have so far gotten from here is not half bad, just dont eat here if at all possible.
author: Melissa B.

description:
One star instead of zero because they're open super, super late. 24 hours, in fact.

Otherwise, the place is super gross and beat-up, like the neighborhood itself, and there's a motley cast of characters that roll through here, especially during late nights.

On one recent 3am visit, for example: an uber-skinny hipster reading Dostoyevsky. A crowd of obnoxious goths/youngsters, one of whom was so drunk and stoned that he sent a chair flying through the restaurant when leaned his exceptionally hefty mass against it in a particularly half-assed way. Quite a few foreign tourists up late and conversing away (gosh, I sure hope this isn't their impression of haute cuisine in the West Bay). And, of course, a variety of neighborhood transients. 

Simply put, combine the gut-busting, lard-laden junk this chain offers, a beat-up shop in a dire neighborhood, and a SKARY clientele, and you have a recipe for SERIOUS SHENANIGANS.
author: Vincent L.

description:
It's not the establishment's fault the clientele smell of urine and BO. But they always get my dang order wrong! 

If you go here #1 hold your nose #2 check your order before leaving.
author: Kory-Oren E.

description: One of the worst fastfoods I've ever been. It smells urine in the restaurant, it's filthy. Restrooms are disgusting. One star just because it's open 24 hours.
author: Lino M.

description: Homeless quotient much higher lately. And they seem angrier towards the staff. The permanent security guard does not seem to ever act on any situation. That there even is a permanent security guard is odd enough. But ultimately the call of Carl's food draws me back occasionally.
author: Ragenvald G.

description: What an experience. We expected about as much from a 24hr fast food joint downtown at 130am, but this was so much more intense than what we were prepared for. Homeless camp feel for sure, but at least half were raising some kind of hell, and all of them smelled like feet. Two stars for food though. Everything was assembled well and the taste was familiar Carl's.  Unless you'd want to bring someone here for some serious perspective, I would probably avoid this place.
author: Tara V.

description:
This Carl's Jr. will never hold out on you when it comes to cardboard drink trays. Between the two of us, we had four hands, one bag o' food, three drinks and two drink trays. Put it all together and you're left one free hand to do with whatever the hell you want. Never underestimate the power of a hand.

The tomato on my burger was nothing to complain about either. I think I mentioned the tomato three times to my man with the free hand once we started devouring food back in our hotel room.
author: Katie C.

description: Inept. The restaurant was not busy at approx 9pm on a Tuesday yet they couldn't get my order number right.  Waited until they called the food description rather than the number.  Unacceptably poor serive. Would give less than 1 if I could.
author: Dean N.

description: Had the mile high bacon. Beef was grey, fries were tasteless, soda was basically just water. Probably won't go back there anytime soon.
author: Julien C.

description:
I know this review will probably get filtered, but I gotta say there's a special place in my heart for a place like this where you can get a bag of onion rings or waffle fries to soak up the booze in your gut and get some free bumfight entertainment at the same time. I'm currently 2 for 2 on that.

The last time I went, there was some kind of heated altercation where a bum in a wheelchair was basically being wheeled out of the place (by /other/ bums, NOT the staff) as he was no longer welcome in the establishment.

The staff here must have a tough shell (or had their souls sucked out of them) to work graveyard at this place all the time.

+2 for the fries, of course.
author: Josh K.

description:
Every time I see those Carl Jr. Commericals, I am like, man I should eat tons of hamburgers. I'll have a rock ass body full of abs! That didn't happen. It's just a lie, like  Paris Hilton knowing how to wash a car. She probably never work a day in her life. I get a big belly and stomach ache while they look good eating it. What a bunch of horse cr*p! First fast food place I knew,  to go the other place from trying to go healthy food, and went with big ass fatty burgers! I give them props for having good burgers even if it's very non healthy. We need a manly burger. The first of the major fast food place I knew to first saw selling Angus beef.   

Here are my three favorite burgers in Carl's Jr. The first one is Western Bacon Cheese Burger: as of this date: two Western Bacon Cheese Burger for $4.99 is a good deal. The second favorite item is the Mushroom and Swiss Burger. MMM-MMM Good. The third and last burger is the Six Dollar Hamburger and what a treat it is.

Salads are ok, try the Cranberry Apple Walnut Grilled Chicken Salad or the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad. 

Breakfast are ok: try the Sourdough Breakfast Sandwich or Steak & Egg Burrito. 

Dessert: Chocolate Chip Cookie, Strawberry Swirl Cheesecake or Chocolate Cake.

Surprising Carl Jr has great ice cream shakes and melts: only second to Sonic. 

Other things they serve that people don't know are Fried Zucchini, Fish and Chips.

None of them are healthy.

Now to the location, this place is different. They hand you numbers when you order your food. There is no drive thru in this location due to the city. Food are quick. One of the staff is so annoying. There is this Asian 'Korean' cashier guy who just rude as hell, and you can never get your order right with him. Still wondering if he ripped me off. Try getting a different cashier if you can, if you have him. 

Inside it isn't bad, it's open to the very late hours. It's also semi clean, just watch out for the crazy customers.. I'm very serious. 

There was multiple times that this Carl Jr had to call the police due to some crazy customer. The last time I was there, a fist fight broke out near the entrance way. 

Overall: Better than most burger places, but still have the same crappy service and crazy customers.   

Still wondering what's the deal with it being call Hardee in East Coast and Carl's Jr in West Coast?! LOL
author: Ivy V.

description:
2.5 stars because the location isn't that great. However,if you are craving a little grease late night this could be the spot if you are really hungry and can't find anything else.

I love the $6.00 burger. Give it to me done and I will eat it.

Enter at your own risk.
author: Dani D.

description:
If you care about your security, DO NOT go there  neither in the afternoon nor in the  evening shifts, for the guards working there can not even take care of difficult customers.  . You can't even trust the security guards working there. It looks to me they just don't care about customer's security. I have noticed how the guards working there  in the afternoon or evening shifts ARE NOT TRAINED to control dangerous situations.
  I have noticed two of the  security wardens in the afternoon shift, arguing with those customers without caring about the integrity of the other customers. ?They just don't know one of those angry customers might have a gun and start fighting everybody inside. "YOU don't argue, nor touch a person." says one of the rules trained wardens should know!. The customers give attitude. The wardens give them more attitude in response!!!! HOw come?
 
Also, I have seen another warden. A tall skinny one letting all his fellows, not customers at all, just do anything they want inside the store, making it a park where "his" fellows" get into the store to rap, sing, dance, and fight. some others, specially his fellows are allowed to enter the dirty bathroom to have sexual intercourse, do drugs, sell stolen property, Trafficking,  and even fighting. Is Carl's Jr. in the United Nations Plaza a safe place to enter??? Definitively , it is not! BE AWARE OF YOUR SAFETY and do not enter Car's Jr. in the afternoon, evening and late shifts.
author: Sachey H.

description: Clean facility, friendly staff and good service. Chicken Tenders and French Fries with a Coke - great way to satisfy that quick grub.
author: Bennett W.

description: I recommend the low carb/Paleo Burger with sweet potato fries. Delicious! Thank you for this offer! So happy!
author: Nic S.

description: How sad that my first meal in California had to be this dump. I had their signature Carl Jr. Sandwich and my first bite should've been my last. Luckily for them, I had nothing to eat on my 5 hour flight so I had to devour this so called "burger."
author: Lianne W.

description:
Expensive fast food/kid's meal: Two pcs. of chicken tenders, criss cut fries, OJ =$6.07  

(+) Tastes Fresh.
(+) Open 24 hrs.
(-) Pricey.
(-) Unfriendly service.
author: Miss E.

description: The chicken wraps I ordered were really badly made.. They overfilled the ranch sauce and I had a messy time eating it. For some reason that day, they took away their garbage cans, so it was really awkward just leaving my garbage on the counter. The fries weren't bad. You may want to go somewhere else if you want a clean environment to eat in, though.
author: Elisa L.

description: Not good, period. Fries were stale/cold and the burger was acceptable but expensive. Best part was the soda - and that was just a Coke.
author: Bryant P.

description:
Went to Carl's Jr for a quick meal.  This place was kind of in the middle of heavy pedestrian traffic.  It didn't help that it was pride weekend.  The restaurant was somewhat dirty.  We both ordered the chicken wraps as combos.  The drinks were good as I got Powerade and my wife got Coke.  The fries were mediocre at best.  

I'd recommend both Ranch and Honey Mustard Chicken wraps.
author: Joel G.

description:
When a normal person thinks of what Hell is truly like - they sometimes think: fire, sinners, and the devil.

When I think of what Hell is - I think of this Carl's Jr.

God forbid anyone ever misses the last BART train of the night and is
forced to venture into this Carl's Jr like us. There were more hookers
inside this place than the classifieds on craigslist. I felt as though I would be stabbed with a dirty needle upon opening the doors.

For some reason, a wheel-chair riding crackhead continuously made attempts to enter the building, but THANK GOD there was a Top Flight security guard there to save the day!

Sadly, this security guard was more infatuated with one of the more attractive hookers, than wheel-chaired bandit, and she entered the place after a struggle.

I feel bad for the poor gay guy that was sitting next to us, because some black man surely destroyed his pride by the end of the night. The same man that claimed that he had enough money in his bank account to "buy dis whole dayum buildin'." 

Lucky.

Maybe i should have took some advice from the bum, two stalls over and brought in a personal of Henessey to pour into my Dr. Pepper. but sadly, we had already consumed all of our liquor. Damn the luck....

If you desire: a hooker, some drug connections, an opportunity to have a rap battle with some junior high dropouts, or just a front-row ticket to a freak show - please, come here.

In a way, it's kind of like going to a zoo - except it's free to get in, and
there's a much higher chance that a monkey will throw feces on you
while you're inside.
author: Donny B.

description: This is much more of a vagrant community center than a fast-food establishment. I feel really bad for the staff: working here has got to be one of the most dangerous jobs in America.
author: Mike B.

description:
Do you have to lie to your boyfriend about having eaten red meat?

Did you run into a girlfriend while unsuccessfully trying to find a dress at Needless Markups randomly on the street, start bitching about anything and everything, feel really hungry and decided to stick it to your SO by enjoying a nice, ridiculously artery-thickening burger at 11am?

Did you also suggest it because your girlfriend's boyfriend told her that "she isn't living up to her potential and should hit the gym", because that is what good friends do?

Then you should probably come here. 

And by probably I mean get your ass there RIGHT NOW.
author: Jaime L.

description:
It's late, your drunk and you wander by Carl's Jr. 
Don't stop.
Keep going. 
Trust me. Learn from my mistake. 
The fact that they need a security guard should let you know what your in for :  
1) Patron exiting Carl's throws cup of soda and ice on group of girls standing in line.
2) One girl grabbing another by hair and pummeling her in face for good 30-40 seconds
 before security steps in.
3) Guys behind you in line laughing and trying to capture attack with camera phone.
4) You get your burger, it's huge and it's awful. Seriously, even drunk it's unacceptable. 
Never again.
author: James F.

description:
I feel compelled to eat here most of the time but never do. Mainly because of the people standing in front. And inside. Yelling. Pissing. Screaming most of the time. 

I do love the jalapeno chicken burger though. Dam you Carl's Jr. 

Don't come to this place late at night because just like any other fast food joint that's 24 hours, this place is a safe haven for the homeless. They even have a security guard standing there making sure no funny business is going on. I pity the workers here and I hope they get paid more than the $9.75 mandated by San Francisco. 

For that jalapeno chicken burger though, it's worth the $5.33 and the passes made at me by the nasty pissing jerks that yell obscenities.
author: Jessica K.

description:
It 's just a normal TL fast food experience at first, a little skeezy here, a little bummy there, a little anxious touristy way over there, no big deal.  

Then I notice the naked man exiting the unisex bathroom (wait - was he wearing clothes when he went in there?).  I try not to stare as he walks toward me, grinning, and sits down directly across the table from me.  Then he wiggles.  

I calmly stand up and leave, pausing to make sure the employee standing near the door has taken note of the naked man.  She sort of nods.  

Two stars for still being able to shock me, San Francisco!
author: Kate J.

description: Omg! What a dump. Never go to Carls Jr. at UN plaza. Smells like piss and full of stteet people. Absolutely revolting.
author: Julie S.

description:
I've eaten here twice, mainly so I could use the bathroom. 

It's not worth it because you'll probably end up with the shits afterwards. 

Barf.
author: Murphy O.

description: Fastfood taste so good when you're hungry, nuff said.
author: Daryl R.

description: I love Carl's Jr's food but this location sucks since I came here to use the bathroom and the cashier says it's for customers only so I told him that I'll buy something after I use it and he was like, "you have to buy something first", so I just left and went somewhere else, screw that crap, I'm not paying to use your bathroom you morons!!. What a bunch of greedy scumbags you guys are!!.
author: Ryan D.

description: Well all I can say its way better then being around 100's  of people in front of the place like the one in united nation plaza, people selling and chilin might seem nice at day but at night its to crowded there. but This location here is good just to go in and out. I live near by and when you want a burger with chilie frys this is the spot. Like I said " Go in go out" and bart is only 30feet away from this place if that helps.
author: Anthony G.

description: I usually make an effort to come here when I'm in the city since there aren't many fast food places back in Berkeley. But although I enjoy the food here, I don't enjoy the ambiance. They are always a few homeless people that barge in sometimes. But the good thing is that they also have a security guard on duty. I also feel that the people that work here always look tired and non-energetic.
author: Diana C.

description: This spot is 24 hrs (thus the 2 stars) so you really have no choice if you want to eat late at night and don't want a sit down meal at a diner. I got really sick from this spot after eating some of those new chicken pieces. Why do these nasty ass fast food restaurants always make things look so good on the picture then end up looking like hell when you eat it. Anyway, I am now associating Carl's Jr. with a healthy case of stomach rot. That and on a hot night you can just smell the bum urine wafting in off Market St as you order here. Nasssssssttyyyyy.
author: David B.

description: Food is decent. I just wouldn't consider this a family friendly joint. The location makes it vulnerable to some sketchy people which is probably why there is a security guard on duty at the door. I went to this place by myself at around 8pm, and didn't have a problem, so it's probably not as bad as it sounds. So if you're looking for a quick bite, this place really does have good Carl's Jr.!
author: Junel S.

description:
Me:  Hello, my name is Martin.

Audience:  Hello, Martin.

Me:  So... my name is Martin and... and...

(weeps openly

I ate a Big Carl last night!

(audience rises and forms a group hug)

I'm what you call a local.  No, not like "oh, I live in Hayes Valley I hang out at this little divey joint around the corner and after hours the bartenders and I smoke cigarettes and have jam sessions" local, like I was born in fucking San Francisco, bitches.  In a fucking commune on Haight--beat *that* for local.

So, I've *been* to this Carl's Jr--several times, in fact.  I am just not afraid of fast food--anyone who thinks they're more likely to get sick from a Big Mac or a Whopper than organic-grain fed free-range whatever doesn't understand just how *much* processing fast food products undergo.  It's not even *food* anymore by the time you get it, and it's mostly soy filler--I'd be willing to bet money that most fast food burgers are borderline veggie burgers.

Anyway, this is all rationalization.  I was roaming up Market St, trying to hustle a cab back to the East Bay because I needed to move my car by 3AM or get a huge ticket.  Well, at 3AM I was still in SF, still a little drunk, and pretty disheartened over the trajectory of the evening, and I thought "you know, I've been on my feet for the past twelve hours--I can get away with a fast food burger."  (Abs in '09!)

I eased carefully around a very ratty man that the very muscular security guard was getting ready to throw through a window, and made my way to the counter, mind boggling at all the burger choices--I went with the biggest picture.

I ordered a Big Carl.

I paid with my Discover card (I get points!).  I stood outside and carefully turned around and watched the gentleman in the black hoody who had started to follow me.  Once the guy saw that I only had a Big Carl, and not a Western Bacon Burger, he realized it wasn't worth the trouble and moved on as the security guard was calling the cops on him.

I sat down in a bus stop and watched the street cleaner rumble past, sheets of water washing away Saturday night's patina of grime, making them ready for Sunday night's.

I ate the burger and felt not a bit better, but a little bit fuller.

I paid $50 for the cab, and I'll pay $80 for the ticket.  But there was something about that long night to myself, that ended with a Big Carl, that I realize now, was special.  I may always remember it.
author: Martin W.

description:
So bad it's actually awesome!

First was introduced to this location by a homeless man who saw my frustration when the BK nearby was closed...had my butt clinched waiting in line to order fearing homicide... Not too bad of a wait for a nice burger chilli fries and a mchick...or whatever they call their chicken sandwich. Great grub for 4am in the part of town Gavin Newsom forgot about.

Came back this time with my hungry girlfiriend in tow, shared a nice meal with the delightful ambience of  lcd tvs and crack heads lighting up under the tables...

Advice: bring a gun.. bring two...pay debit , have your order ready to fly out of there once you picked it up. Welcome to the TL.
author: Rocky H.

description:
I've come here three times in the last few months looking for an interesting story involving the ne'er-do-wells of Halide Plaza.  But each time I've come, the coefficient-of-urban-decay hasn't met my expectations.  It's not nearly as sketchy as the Carl's at U.N. Plaza ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/unsOamk3Dio4GN81xuPVcA ), but much dodgier than the one at 4 Embarcadero ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/0ORVOsB6GmsmNyyXOuW8aw ).

My regulation Western-bacon combo wasn't much different than the one I'd had at U.N. Plaza...the burger was tasty, though it's haphazard assembly compelled me to lift the bun and re-arrange the beef and bacon to achieve an acceptable degree of aesthetic symmetry. The drink selection included my favorite...the seldom-found Nestea Raspberry flavored Iced Tea.  The fries were OK, though a bit mushy.  The presence of an unmolested self-serve drink station is further proof that this location has gotten it's problem with street-people under control.

It's the dullest of the three Carl's Jr's in San Francisco.  For sheer dining experience and superior presentation, try the one at Embarcadero Center.  For a tenderloin-class freak show, hit up the one at U.N. Plaza.  This place will save you the hassle of walking down to Embarcadero Center 4, but if you're headed that way, I'd advise holding out till you get there...
author: Mike W.

description: I've been here about 2 years ago and the food was good. The area is not great but the service seems consistent.
author: Jaime R.

description: Most disgusting food I have ever eaten in my entire life. And, I don't ask for much when it comes to fast food in the middle of the night, but we couldn't even eat the crap they served us. Close this place.
author: Joel T.

description:
So what better way to end a bad night off than letting yourself go with a greasy burger and fries...

It was a burger joint I have always wanted to try and it was open 24 hours, both promising traits.

We wandered around in the cold and finally made it here.

Came inside and glanced over the menu.  There were nice 6 dollar burgers and you could get chili cheese fries.  All sounded like a good plan.

I ordered proceeded to eat because I was starving, the whole time thinking, this is an over priced burger king.

The next morning, I knew this was the wrong choice as all of it came up and it looked as appealing as it did going down.  GROSS on both accounts.
author: David N.

description:
Oh what can I say. This place is really classy, The greasy burgers, the light that cast their rays all over the place to illuminate a landscape of destitute homeless people that a documentary director would go to town on; where if you ever wondered what it was like to go hell: you could find out by going to the restroom, then having to run out to clean your hands after entering a restroom with such biological diversity.
I like Carls Jr, but I ain't never going into this one.
author: Enrique M.

description:
I continue to order food from this place even though the neighborhood is a bit sketch. I also do it even though they put cheese in my burger when I'm LACTOSE INTOLERANT. I should've checked my burger before I left to go back to work, but I assumed that my "no cheese" would have been clear.  

I have learned to hate cheese, the taste, the smell because of the pain it brings me. But since I was already back at work, I decided to eat it. My criss-cut fries were bomb as usual and my soda wasn't flat. Next time I go there, I'll double check the burger.  Let's hope I won't end up in the bathroom for the rest of my shift....
author: Lisa X.

description:
won't let customer use restroom before ordering. 
the place is dirty. the security is the rudest i ever seen.
author: John L.

description:
I go to school right next door to this Carl's Jr. I understand that a lot of drugged up/strange characters come in, and the employees have to deal with them, but that does NOT mean they have to automatically  treat everyone who walks in for a quick snack or drink like total dirt. 

First off, I'm not expecting the food quality to be great, it's a fast food place.  The employees to have constant scowls on their faces and obviously dislike their jobs. It's screwed up that they're going to take it out on any customer they choose. Apparently I deserve to be made fun of for ordering coffee with no sugar and cream? Really petty, ignorant people, and for the quality of the food the prices aren't worth it. 

Really if you're going to make fun of me for ordering something as commonplace as coffe, just because I don't like sugar or cream, there's plenty of other places I can take my business, and from now on, will. A shame because its location near my school was convenient.
author: Sally O.

description:
A few mornings ago, I woke with "American Psycho" on my mind. I hadn't seen the film in awhile, so the sudden recollection was kind of weird. The movie is about a self-involved yuppie who kills people for pleasure, because he's "psycho" and, let's face it, very "American." And while it's a good film, it's not really something I enjoyed watching. It's graphic, messy, disturbingly sordid and not quite right...

Perfectly descriptive of the burger I had at Carl's Jr. 

Now, I've only shared wonderful (tender) moments with Carl's Jr. in the past, but that was out in suburbia where fast food still maintains a measure of quality. In the city, fast food finds reservation for the bummy and slightly smelly. It's the sad perpetuation of a vicious cycle - with so much relatively cheap, good food in SF, why would the rational man, with the extra dollar, suffer fast food? And so the quality goes down the crapper (along with the rest of your night's intake), and Carl's Jr. succeeds in doing what Christian Bale may or may not have done: slowly kill hobos.

So, I go for a run, and I notice the Clay plans on playing that same film tonight at midnight. Scary. Now I'm wondering if it's a sign from God that I should go out and slash some hookers with a kitchen knife, or, you know, go watch the movie again.
author: Keane L.

description:
Much better for wicked quickie depraved bathroom sex than the Burger King. 

(See my review of Burger King)
author: Brian S.

description:
Job hunting takes me into some odd neighborhoods.  

Due to the timing of my Muni commute, I found myself at 7th and Market at precisely the time I was scheduled to answer a phone call.  Not partial to donuts, I decided to stop at the Carl's Junior on the northwest corner.  Entering the restaurant, I detected a strong scent of eau de camp nuit, but it faded as I moved away from the guy sitting at the first table inside the door.  

The breakfast sandwich looked like a good deal, so I ordered it with a diet Coke.  A breakfast sandwich consists of scrambled eggs and a sausage patty on a sourdough English muffin.  This ten million calorie treat is the perfect complement to a diet Coke, and the whole banquet was priced at a mere $5.30.  

Seated in the window, admiring the sunshine and the strange denizens of this boundary between the Tenderloin and SOMA, I was grateful to have perfect cell reception for a phone interview.  It charged my day with a sense of mission, to put it mildly.
author: David D.

description:
WARNING: Not for the faint of heart or stomach!

What's the ruling on throwing it up before you digest it? All I can say is - Don't eat here, you'll regret it, I know I did...and I still am regretting it, probably will tomorrow as well - perfectly good waste of Anchor Steam and Bushmills...
author: Todd E.

description: I am from TX and we have recently had Carl's Jr. come to the state.  I've yet to try them here so, I wanted to try this "west coast" classic.  We visited this location on 01/12 and were amazed at how lackluster this burger was.  It was sloppy and seemed to be thrown together.  This location is sorta disgusting and the bathroom especially made me want to vomit.  How can you mess up a fast food hamburger?  Not impressed.
author: Mark M.

description: NASTY!!!!! DUUURRRTTYYY!!!! STANNNKKYYY!!!!! Don't eat here!!! Its just not right in there! There's flies!!!! I dont know why the hell we still ate there after seein that place! We jus wanted to getta quick bite b4 we went to Macys. I shoulda jus starved!!!!! I was so mad when I went to Macys and say that they had food on their bottom level!
author: Garnette M.

description:
This was the second time I ever had Carl's Jr, that I could only remember Paris Hilton commercial, that after a complete crash of my computer plus all my backup files, I needed some really unhealthy food on my way home to fill my blues.

Yeah, nothing to report much on the chewy burger (definitely more than just Angus beef, definitely some tendon and other elastic parts of the cow), the high fat fries with the extra ketchup, high calories drink that filled my insatiable stomach, and the really slow service that gave me some time space to space my mind out.
author: T L.

description:
While cruising around with a friend at 3 in the morning, I thought, "Hey, I didn't know Carl's Jr. was opened 24 hours?  Let's grab a bite!"  The homeless guy outside was friendly enough.  He said he was picking up coffee for his boss and he opened the door for me.  He also asked for some change.  I told him I didn't have any but I'd give him some after I bought my meal.

The guy behind the counter, stout with the demeanor of a pitt bull and an intense Latin accent, barked at me to take my order.  I did.  Gave some change to the homeless guy behind me and sat down to eat.  Klink.  A crack pipe falls out of his wallet.

Behind him, three of the biggest thuggish looking guys I've ever seen stroll in.  I could see why management hired the Spanish Bulldog.  Staring up at the three he barks at them just like he barked at us.  Brave guy.

After they leave, three homeless guys in the corner get into an argument.  One of them slaps his soda off his table across the room, splashing against the wall.  My friend suggest we should go.  Understatement of the year.  If you're in the mood for danger and excitement, or simply want to play Indiana Jones in the temple of Junior's, you won't be disappointed.
author: Tony L.

description: Being from the east coast, I wanted to try Carl's Jr because we don't have any around us.  Now that I've tried Carl's Jr, I'm glad they aren't on the east coast. Leaves more room for McDonalds and Burger King and any other burger place, which are probably all better. It wasn't the absolute worst burger I've ever had, but it was not a good burger either. Dry, tasteless, and a lot of the menu seemed incredibly overpriced considering the ultra low quality of the food. Not to mention this location was full of crackheads both inside and out. And they didn't stop 3-4 separate beggars from begging inside for money and food. Okay, I understand compassion, but I don't want to be approached repeatedly while I'm eating for spare change. Wouldn't go back.
author: Sam O.

description: According to my friend, this is 'the best Carl's Jr.'s he's ever had.' Not sure if it was the intoxicated part of him talking... but it tasted like regular good ole' Carls to me.
author: Jacqueline N.

description:
Feel the need to see some crack heads fighting over change? 

How bout a heroin addict shooting up in the bathroom? 

Anyone? Hello, anyone? 

... Didn't think so

Don't go here
author: Sarah W.

description:
Considering the location, this is a pretty good place. There is a homeless problem in the whole area, so they were nice enough to hire security to control the problem. Not the mall security that does nothing but a real person who does something. 

It is tough doing business anywhere, but especially here. They do their best effort to have anyone who can pay for an item to come in and kick the rest out.
author: M C.

description: It's places like this that give San Francisco such a bad name. This place was more than disgusting. There were homeless people all over the place. Went in to buy a soda so I could use the bathroom. The bathroom, disgusting!!! About an inch of pee on the bathroom floor and god knows what else. I felt like I was in some 3rd world country. This place made me ask the question, is there such a thing as sub-species in humans? There's one thing being down and out there's quite another thing to lose any ounce of human decency that could exist. It's places like this that makes me so happy not to live anywhere near this god forsaken "city."
author: Victoria B.

description:
Jager.
Goldschlager.
Apple pucker.
22 of Anchor Steam.
40 bucks worth of Jack and Diet.
And some random shots.

The day after that  I LURVE Carls Jr.  Nothing beats a double western with onion rings smothered in thousand island.

Disgusting I know.  I have already planned my night at the gym to make up for it.
author: Ian M.

description: At least this one smelled alright.  No dollar menu, so we walked to 7-11 and spent 6bux each on a bunch of goodies.
author: David D.

description:
I'm sorry i'm going to have to give this place 5 stars for all the crappiness it's worth! 

Right around the corner from my work, I walk through this "ghetto" to obtain my greasy, heart attack artery clogging  fast food. 

Food: Quality fast food crap. Yeah, I get those cravings for Carl's JR. I'm a victim of it, and proud of it!! I always order the Western Bacon Cheese burger. Today I'm a fatty and got a double with fries & a coke...I think I'm still hungry....

Service: Mediocre. I had no problem...you can't beat a place that you are in and out in roughly 3 minutes. Really it was that quick!

Dining: I'd take it to go. I don't necessarily know about sticking around to eat at this place. Not the cleanest or comfiest. 

So run in and get your burger, and hey you'll probably run into a few drug deals on the way in. 

Well worth my fast food craving....5 stars only cause it's fun gettin fast food on the edge of the TL
author: Catherine O.

description: I just stopped by and ordered a Six Dollar Burger and large fry.   I understand that it's late but nobody likes cold fries, as mine were.  I understand also that it's fast food and to not have great expectations but if I'm paying six dollars for your burger, put ripe tomatoes on it,  not pale pinkish green. WTF??
author: Ajaib S.

description:
Okay, I'm usually not a complainer, but...

I had to wait 20 minutes (out of 30 minute lunch hour) just to order my fucking food. It was busy-ish, but not that busy. When I finally got to the counter the guy couldn't get my order right. This wasn't a "triple venti mocha low fat skip the foam extra hot" order. It was " May I please have the 3 piece chicken strip meal" order.  Jesus , all I wanted was some chicken! Plus I always get harrassed by the homeless on my (short) walk over- not that is Carl Junior's fault but it still irks me.
author: Jessica R.

description: "Never ever go to this place." I don't believe Carl's Jr can keep such kind of supervisor. I went with my kid's. I had donated earlier for the troops at one of their other locations so I had some coupons which were valid. The supervisor name "PIA" a phillipeno girl was very rude. She did not bothered to even look at the coupon and she said "this coupon is not valid" I told her this is valid unto the end of next month please see that. Then she said only one coupon at a time. I said where it is written. She don't even showed me and told rudely to be on side. She gave me that discrematory look. when I asked her to talk to her manager, she said I have to talk to her only. I can't believe Carls Jr. Can keep such kind of supervisor, this shows there hiring system.
author: Nick F.

description:
This is a sketchy fast food place in a sketchy part of town. During the day, this Carl's Jr caters to the wage slaves in the Civic Center plaza. Once 5 o'clock rolls around, you can't help but notice the influx of homeless people around the restaurant. Every once in a while, someone will come in to try to buy a 99 cent Big Burger and use the restroom. Depending on who has night manager duty, people might come in with empty plastic cups to fill up at the beverage bar. They usually have a security guard there at night, and for good reason. Some of the patrons can get aggressive with the counter staff and other diners.

So why go there at night? Well, those spicy chicken sandwiches can be addictive, and the place is open 24/7. When I went to Hastings nearby, I'd grab a bite to eat while studying and tell myself that if I didn't do well, I'd wind up being the night manager here. Yes, sometimes negative reinforcement works.
author: Timothy O.

description: My first day in San Francisco this past week we were pretty hungry after the plane ride because they did not give us food. We go out and about to search for some food and come across Carl Jr's...ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS FOOD! OMG if you go with a group of people have everyone get a different burger and just try each other's. We got the Guacamole Burger, Teriyaki Burger, Mushroom Burger, and Chili Cheese Fries. So Amazing every single Burger and Fries. I usually do not like chili cheese fries but these were soooo good! and my favorite burger was the Mushroom burger oh man sooo good, definitely a MUST!
author: Jess K.

description: They gave me the wrong order. Found out miles away. Stuip azz
author: Mark H.

description:
I am not a fast food person, but out of the few choices I have downtown (McDonald's and Burger King), this is the best place to go to for a good deal. I'm just saying.

*Hooray for the naturally cut fries.
author: Alex Y.

description:
holy shit i wanted a late nite burger to go not to get knifed.

also as the only person in there that would have passed a toxicology test how dare you give me attitude for being a little miffed that i had to wait longer than anyone else. 

all i ordered was a double western burger to go and no joke, 9-10 people after me ordered and got their stuff and i was the only one remaining some 15 mins later when my burger was finally called. rude bitch didn't say sorry for the wait or nothing. in fact that made the staff more ghetto than the environment & that's hard to do there esp. @ nite.
author: Jeremy D.

description: Don't do it. Even while drunk, it still tasted like ass. Next time, I'll hit one of the many donut places on Market St to soak up all the booze.
author: Maria D.

description: The waiters here are nice. The food is good, and I went here a lot when I was a kid. There are a lot of tables to sit at. Parking can be a pain, but if you want fast food, it is worth the wait. The views of San Francisco from this fast food joint are nice. The place is part of Union Square.
author: DJ Guan Yu M.

description:
I laugh every time I think about this place. After a concert, we wanted snacks and a bathroom.  Heading towards BART Carl's Jr. sounded pretty good.  The four of us girls got in line, two of us headed to the bathroom door which displayed a typed 8.5 x 11 sheet of paper that implied that bathrooms are only Coustomers only.  OMG.  The unnecessary "O" was scribbled out.  Man, I forgot to take a photo of that.  When the two girls stood outside the bathroom the security guard in a sweatshirt and jeans, playing random songs on his cell phone so everyone can hear said you have to buy something before using the bathroom.  O------Kaaaayyyyy.  Sure.  The girls got back in line with us.  We bought our Fried Zucchini and Criss Cut Fries and were allowed to finally-finally use the bathroom.  AND!  I needed more 'house dressing'. I stood at the counter waiting for the cashier around the corner.  He did, but was in the middle of blowing his nose.  He finished, wiped the rest of the wetness with his hands roughly and quickly and I was utterly disgusted.  

Note to self - no more visits to fast food joints that have security.  

Note #2 to self - Never come here again.

Awe, man! Do I even have to give them a star?
author: Bernadette M.

description: I'm a big fan of burgers, specially Carl's Jr. but if it wasn't because of the atmosphere ill give it 4 stars. there are always homeless people asking for food. i was enjoying the other day a capn crunch smoothie which was freaking good. if it wasn't because there was a homeless guy peeing next to me then that day would have been great.....damn homeless guy, you had to pee in the restaurant....i think the employees are afraid that if they call the cops, the homeless people who hangout inside might do something to them or the restaurant.
author: Christian P.

description: I come here a couple times a month for breakfast as I just love the sausage croissant sandwiches. I've never really had any issues with the food quality as it seems fine and pretty much consistent with other Carls Jrs I visit. Yes, the ambience is not the greatest but considering that it is right on the edge of the Tenderloin, what can you expect? Vagrants and users abound here and I can imagine that this would not make for ideal working conditions, but I really gotta say that the level of service provided by the employees really SUCKS ass. One girl in particular named Cristobel is hands down one of the rudest people I've ever seen working in the service industry. You come in and greet her and all she does is stand there giving you a dirty look!! The employees must be so used to having to deal with troublemakers that they just automatically treat everyone the same. Total disrespect!!
author: Lou E.

description: This was a perfectly fine burger place.  Succumbing to Carl's Jr.'s incessant marketing of their portobello mushroom burger during Giants broadcasts, I went in today and got one with an order of fries.  I must say it was quite tasty indeed.  The lettuce and tomato inside the burg were fresh, the portobello slices were plentiful, the fries were done just right, and it all even held up well after a 15 minute drive home.  And the counter service was fast.  Maybe it's just that the street people outside don't bother me like other reviewers, or that I got my food to go instead of watching the neighborhood go by, but it was sure A-OK by me.
author: moosedog i.

description: I guess it just depends what you're looking for.  I came in for a burger.    Not the best. 3 stars. Kinda cold.  Cold fries. -1 star.  +1 star for the entertainment value of the guy who rode into the restaurant on his bicycle and wove up and down past every table.  -1 star because he took someone's sandwhich while riding by.  - 1 star for the sort of Civic Center (y) smell and heightened sense of danger that you feel while eating there.  Unless you dig that.  Some do.
author: Mark N.

description: Carl's Jr. is my favorite fast food hamburgers (Super Star) and it's unfortunate there aren't more franchises around town because I hate and refuse to come downtown unless I have to work or have some other necessary reason so I seldom get to eat these things (which might be a blessing in disguise).  The store itself doesn't feel real clean but it isn't exactly in the best part of town either.  Layout is not good--drink fountains are on the wrong side of where the tables are and one has to cross the lines of people waiting to order.  Wish there were more stores.
author: Kai T.

description: Get the "Six Dollar Bacon Western Cheeseburger" -- it's only 5 bucks! And so delicious!
author: Iain B.

description: The question here is do you like roaches hanging out with you while you eat (not the smoke able kind) or drunks( that water would run from ) standing over you asking you if your going to finish it .or some dope phen  chick with her kid asking you to help buy her 2 month old son some food (like he eats burgers and fries)
author: patrita t.

description: I should have known better to go here after partying for NYE but we were SO hungry! Lets put it this way, it smells like fried food and bad BO, complete chaos inside, a bum passed out in his own vomit on a table in the corner....need I say more? I'd rather starve than go back here.
author: Matt K.

description: Typical burger joint. Agree the bacon double cheeseburger is good, but the fries are lacking. Only a once in a while place for me. Location though is a major hangout for homeless and those looking to panhandle so if you are skiddish or nervous you need to pass. Company needs to do more to enforce the no trespass orders. Location is open 24 hours and is upstairs from Powell Street BART and MUNI.
author: Anthony F.

description: The location, cleanliness, customer service, etc. bring this place down to a 1star. But... being that is Carl's Jr., and it is open 24 HOURS-A-DAY (and night), I must at least give it one more star. Others will scoff, but this is best institutionalized greasy spoon fast food on the west coast. True, this is NOT the best location. Yet, I respect nearly any "restaurant" that dares to be open at all times.
author: Brian P.

description: True, I do eat at fast food restaurants and they are all equally bad but what turns me off from this place is how colossal the burgers are here.  As you can see from their commercials you can just see the fat dripping and the types of burgers they come with just look plain nasty.  Not for me--enter at your own risk!
author: Mel P.

description:
do people actually eat this shit?
i got a soda here.......this place scared the shit out of me
it was like night of the living dead vs. drunk skateboarders vs. a bunch of really scared German chicks.
if you like to eat garbage, make friends with crackheads and are looking to fight a drunk guy, this is the place for you.
hell you might even score a hypodermic in your fries!
author: Adam F.

description: If ever you find yourself on Market Street near the Powell BART Station and are in the mood for some really great Fast Food, you really need to visit this Carl's Jr. It maybe a little bit more expensive than the Burger King a block away, but the burgers are a lot bigger more flavorful. I usually order the #2 Superstar Combo Meal--a large charbroiled burger with 2 beef patties, medium fries and medium drink. The Fried Zucchini is also great. I also love their Six Dollar Burgers are huge burgers fit for a king. It's also great when I have my meal sitting at the windows so I can watch the world go by as interesting people go about their shopping. Their maybe a few panhandlers outside of the store, but they usually don't cause much trouble. Not only does this place take Credit Cards and is open 24 Hours, the beautiful actress Audrina Patridge in her golden bikini lying on the beach eating a Carl's Jr burger promotes this place--you may even catch a glimpse of her Carls Jr t.v. commercial on the television screens they have in the store.
author: Robert T.

description: it's nice to see this place packed with european tourists late at night, fattening up on fast food the ugly american style!  this is a review for the actual restaurant and food, not what happens outside or around it like some yelpers who seem to forget how to yelp.  the western bacon cheeseburger is the all time hands down best burger ever and it was nice to eat you again last night.
author: Pickle R.
